intro: Primula tsariensis, commonly known as the imperial primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a cool, moist environment. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
